column4: that sounds intruiging.  I'm interested.  No idea how to go about searching for it, though
start by googling something like "Wuala alternatives"?
my guess would be something about too resource-intensive
wouldn't it be almost as simple to just host your own filelocker server?
frankly, I have no clue what you're talking about.  All I know is that it sounds awesome, and it sounds like if bittorrent was a file-system
mark that as another search: bittorrent file-system
was thinking on how that could work, the uptime component would be pretty important
while (at a glance) I'd still say they're the best cloud drive option out there,  the trading feature sounds _epic_
the obvious solution is to write an open-source version
do you happen to know if any of their code was open-source?
I would agree, it is pretty awesome.  And no, I don't believe any of it was open source.  I wish I had more experience in such things or I'd ask Wuala if I could make use of it.
if they don't offer that anymore, is it really competition?
but it's a different 'service' -- they offer an (encrypted) "cloud thumb drive", we'd be trying to create "bit-torrent fs"
the biggest problem I can see, on the implementation side of things, is whether you'd need any centralized components...
